DOC.brief_summary: Participants diagnose tibial femoral knee osteoarthritis assign one three treatment group include : active transcutaneous electrical nerve stimulation ( TENS ) , placebo TENS , control group . Assignment condition conceal . All participant three group receive physical therapy 4 week intervention . Main outcome measure include quadriceps central activation ratio , quadriceps torque production , WOMAC score , visual analog pain score gait well knee joint kinetics kinematics gait . The purpose study determine continuous use TENS therapy activity daily live rehabilitation positively impact outcome measure .
DOC.brief_title: The Effect Transcutaneous Electrical Nerve Stimulation Quadriceps Central Activation Gait
DOC.criteria: Patients diagnose Kellgren Lawrence grade 1 4 Tibial Femoral Knee OA least one leg diagnose OA physician use evidence confirm imaging study , arthroscopy , visualization past surgical procedure , medical report confirm OA use image study , arthroscopy , visualization past surgical procedure . Patients age 18 80 year age . Patients CAR le 90 % . Patients pregnant . Patients seek medical attention trauma knee injury within past 6 month . Patients orthopaedic low extremity surgery past 6 month , surgery would inhibition proper function study methodology . Patients diagnosis Rheumatoid Arthritis . Patients know hypersensitivity electrical stimulation . Patients type neuropathy . Patients know muscular abnormality . Patients history heart condition precludes exercise . The technique perform leg total knee replacement , leg meet inclusion criterion subject perform study non reconstruct leg . Patients diagnosed malignancy stimulate electrode site ( thigh knee ) . Patients serious infection near stimulate electrode site ( thigh knee ) Patients knee injection past 2 week . Patients unable walk series 30 meter without walk assistance device .
